intro: Selinum rablense, commonly known as the Alpine cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its seeds are small and produce a distinctive, slightly bitter flavor. Selinum rablense is often found in meadows and along mountain paths, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
